statement.p: A coffee distributor plans to mix some House coffee that sells for \displaystyle\${8.70} per pound with some Queen City coffee that sells for \displaystyle\${14.00} per pound to create \displaystyle{30} pounds of a new coffee blend that will sell for \displaystyle\${10.82} per pound.
How many pounds of each kind of coffee should they mix? Round to the nearest pound. pounds of House coffee. pounds of Queen City coffee.
